item.title: Technical Career Planning: Growth, Strategy, and Building for the Future
item.description:
I had someone reach out to me with the following questions:

I would value your perspective on:

Technical Growth: How to transition from feature development to architectural thinking (CI/CD, Cloud Infrastructure, Scalability).

Career Strategy: Advice on positioning myself for opportunities (perhaps in the US market) where I can solve more complex engineering problems.

The Bigger Picture: Given my goal to eventually build an IT firm here in Ghana, I’d love to hear your thoughts on what technical foundations I need to master now to lead engineering teams in the future.

I’ve gotten away from writing regularly, but I’m trying to get back to it. I flew out to Boston for work last week, and on the flight there I read “Enshittification” by Cory Doctorow. I enjoyed it and it sort of resonated with meâ€”all these platforms that we use every day are just bad. I see more ads than updates from friends. Even when the posts are from humans, they feel like they’re gaming the system. They’re writing things that are trying to get views rather than trying to connect with people. So yeah, I don’t really enjoy social media much anymore.
